intro: Rudgea parquioides subsp. parquioides, commonly known as the Parquioides rudgea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
